https://github.com/CPBridge/ct_body_composition/blob/master/stats/lms_curves.R
https://rpubs.com/Haibiostat/centile_estimation
https://www.gamlss.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/centilesEstimation-24-7-2013.pdf
https://www.gamlss.com
http://www.gamlss.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/gamlss-manual.pdf

Eilers P Et al. 2015 Twenty Years of P-splines
van Buuren et al. 2001 Worm Plot: A simple diagnostic ...
Cole, Green et al. 1992 Smoothing Reference Centile Curves: The LMS method and penalized likelihood
Stasinopoulos et al. 2007 Journal of Statistical Software Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape (GAMLSS) in R

# Setup {.tabset}


```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(gamlss)
library(tidyverse)
library(DT)
#change working directory to main directory:
setwd(gsub('/centile_curves', '', getwd()))
source('centile_curves/centile_curves_util.R')


source('filter_merge_full_data.R')
```

## Load data:

```{r load_data, include=FALSE}
#change working directory to main directory:
setwd(gsub('/centile_curves', '', getwd()))

#See if data has previously been gathered and saved, to save time:
sheet_created <- file.exists('read_data/df_main.RData')

if(sheet_created){
  load('read_data/df_main.RData')
}else{
  #Gather data.
  merged_datasheet <- filter_merge_full_data()
  
  #Exclude cancer
  merged_datasheet_no_cancer <- exclude_medical_reasons(merged_datasheet, c('exclude_cancer'))
  
  #Exclude based on QA
  questions <- get_questions()
  df_excluded <- exclude_rows_based_on_questions(merged_datasheet_no_cancer, questions[['questions']], questions[['exclusion_questions']]
                                                 , questions[['muscle_exclusion_questions']], questions[['sat_exclusion_questions']])
  
  #Update has_T5, has_T8, has_CT1, ..
  df_excluded <- add_patient_level_data(df_excluded)
  
  #Reduce to one series per participant, preferring the more recent CT2.
  df <- reduce_to_one_study_per_participant(df_excluded, prefer_CT = 2)
  
  #Rename metrics:
  df <- df %>% dplyr::rename(CSMA = muscle_area_cm2, SMI = skeletal_muscle_index, SMRA = muscle_mean_hu, SMG = skeletal_muscle_gauge)
  
  #Store to make future loading quicker:
  save(df, file='read_data/df_main.RData')
}

#Restrict age range to [38, 80] interval, since outside of that the data density is much lower and edge effects occur
df <- df %>% filter(age >= 38 & age <= 80)
```

## Build models:

```{r construct_models, include = TRUE, echo=TRUE}
#Construct for each metric, vertebral level, and sex:
#Models with different k, between 1, 2 (corresponding to AIC), and log(n) + 1 (with n being the sample size)
#to cover room around and within the Akaike Information criterion and the Schwarz Bayesian Information Criterion

#Then follow the automatic model selection approach #1 suggested by Rigby & Stasinopoulos et al., 2014
#Save different models and their respective evaluation criteria in a grid-like table to enable later selection of the best one

#change working directory to main directory:
setwd(gsub('/centile_curves', '', getwd()))

metrics <- c('CSMA', 'SMI', 'SMRA', 'SMG')

sexes <- c('Female', 'Male')
vertebral_levels <- c('T5', 'T8', 'T10', 'L3')
age <- 'age'

#See if previously created, then just load in to save time:
sheet_created <- file.exists('centile_curves/models.RData')

if(sheet_created){
  print('Loading models from file centile_curves/models.RData')
  load('centile_curves/models.RData')
}else{

  models <- list()
  
  
  for(metric in metrics){
    for(lvl in vertebral_levels){
      for(sex in sexes){
        
        #store all models under metric_sex_lvl, i.e. CSMA_T5_Female
        model_name <- paste(metric, sex, lvl, sep='_')
        print(paste('Fitting models:', model_name))
        #Get datasheet for this combination
        sheet <- df %>% filter(Sex == sex, vertebral_level == lvl)
        #drop NAs for the given metric. 
        sheet <- sheet[, c(age, metric)] %>%
          drop_na()
        #Rename column with the metric to 'metric', since lms function works with get(deparse(substitute(arg)), envir=as.environment(data))
        #-> no variables can be passed in, since the call will always be inspected
        sheet <- data.frame(age = sheet$age, metric=sheet[[metric]])
       
        
        #Create grid of models
        #Grid of GAIC parameters: 1, 2(like AIC), 2.5, 15, log(n) (like BIC), log(n)+1, and 4 steps between 2 and log(n)
        n <- nrow(sheet)
        gaic_penalties <- round(sort(c(1, seq(2, log(n), length.out=6), log(n)+1, 2.5, 15)), digits = 1)
        model_grid <- list()
        for(i in 1:length(gaic_penalties)){
          #Actual modeling call
          gaic_penalty <- gaic_penalties[i]
          print(paste('Fitting with GAIC(k=', gaic_penalty, ')', sep=''))
          #Use box cox power exponential distribution
          model <- lms(x=age,y=metric, data=sheet, families="BCPEo",
                       method.pb="GAIC", cent=c(3,5,10,25,50,75,90,95,97), k=gaic_penalty)
          #Save model:
          model_grid[[i]] <- model
        }
        
        #Get dataframe comparing the models and store it in the list.
        graphics.off() 
        par("mar") 
        par(mar = c(1, 1, 1, 1))
        models[[model_name]] <- compare_models(model_grid, gaic_penalties = gaic_penalties, wormplot_stats=T)
        
      }
    }
  }
  
  #save the newly created models:
  save(models, file='centile_curves/models.RData')
}
```
# Model Selection:

As documented in CentileCurveModelDecisions.docx we used this R Markdown document to select the best model out of the fitted once.

Below we will select these. If questions are raised concerning this selection, the authors will be available to talk about each individual choice,
which was documented in the process.

```{r save_model_decisions}
main_cohort_models <- list()

set_model <- function(metric, lvl, sex, gaic_penalty_k){
  chosen_model <- (models[[paste(metric, sex, lvl, sep='_')]] %>% filter(gaic_penalty == gaic_penalty_k))$model[[1]]
  if(is.null(chosen_model)){
    return('Something went terribly wrong!')
    
  }
  main_cohort_models[[paste(metric, sex, lvl, sep='_')]] <<- chosen_model
  plot_centiles(chosen_model, metric, sex, lvl, centiles = c(3, 15, 50, 85, 97))
}

#Select the 32 models
set_model('CSMA', 'T5', 'Female', 2.5) 
set_model('CSMA', 'T5', 'Male', 3)

set_model('CSMA', 'T8', 'Female', 2)
set_model('CSMA', 'T8', 'Male', 3)

set_model('SMI', 'L3', 'Male', 3.1)

set_model('SMRA', 'T5', 'Male', 6)

set_model('SMRA', 'T10', 'Female', 5.3)
set_model('SMRA', 'T10', 'Male', 2.5)

set_model('SMRA', 'L3', 'Female', 4.2)
set_model('SMRA', 'L3', 'Male', 2.5)


set_model('SMG', 'T5', 'Female', 3)
set_model('SMG', 'T5', 'Male', 4)

set_model('SMG', 'T8', 'Female', 2.5)
set_model('SMG', 'T8', 'Male', 4.1)

set_model('SMG', 'T10', 'Female', 3.1)
set_model('SMG', 'T10', 'Male', 3.1)

set_model('SMG', 'L3', 'Female', 3.1)
set_model('SMG', 'L3', 'Male', 3.1)




save(main_cohort_models,file =  paste('main_cohort_reference_curve_models_', as.character(Sys.Date()),'.RData', sep='')) 

```
